Authors:
Edward Williams, Zachary Theis, Christopher Andrew
Hoess
Title:
Identifying a Cryptic Adiantum Population through DNA
Barcoding
Keywords:
Adiantum aleuticum, Adiantum pedatum, serpentine, rbcL,
trnL-F
Abstract:
Populations of Adiantum pedatum L. sensu lato growing on
serpentine barrens in Pennsylvania and Maryland have at times been
identified as A. pedatum L. var. aleuticum Rupr. and subsequently as A.
aleuticum (Rupr.) C.A.Paris. The latter species, together with the
allopolyploid A. viridimontanum C.A.Paris, is known from serpentine in
New England and Canada. A phylogenetic analysis based on two plastid
markers showed that the Pennsylvania and Maryland populations are A.
pedatum sensu stricto rather than A. aleuticum or A.
viridimontanum.
